summary: porcine hemagglutinating encephalomyelitis is an acute and highly contagious disease in pigs. the disease is caused by a member of the Coronaviridae family. it is an enveloped virus containing a non-segmented, single-stranded, positive-sense RNA genome of approximately 30 kb. miRNAs play a key role in the infection of coronavirus and the neurovirulent virus. miR-17, mir-574-5p, and miR-214, were up-regulated. miR-98 and miR-223 were down-regulated. miR-21 protects against myocardial apoptosis by specifically inhibiting the expression of its target programmed cell death 4 (PDCD4). these data proved miR-21 might be a novel target for the treatment of CVB3 infection and other apoptosis-mediated cardiovascular diseases. RT-PCR for miRNA and mRNA Expression miRNA-enriched total RNA was extracted from N2a cells, Hela cells and brain tissues of mice infected with PHEV. RNA was reverse transcribed into cDNA by using the reverse transcription kit (Takara, Japan) miR-21a-5p and Caskin1 expressions were determined by RT-PCR using the 2-CT method. anti-sense primer, 5′-CTCAACTACATGGTCTACATGTTC-3′; anti-sense primer, 5′-AGCGATGAGGCTCTCTACTA-3′; and anti-sense primer, 5′-TTGCCAGAATTCTCTACG-3′. reaction conditions: pre-degeneration at 95°C for 3 min, denaturation at 95°C for 30 s, annealing at 60°C for 30 s, extension at 72°C X-tremeGENE HP DNA Transfection Reagent was used to co-transfected Hela cells with 50 nM miR-21a-5p mimic or 100 nM inhibitor. luciferase activity was detected after transfecting 48 h by using a dual luciferase reporter assay system (Promega) oligonucleotides and a scrambled siRNA were used as the negative controls. the cells were inoculated with virus 12 h after the transfection. all the transfection experiments were repeated at least three times. TCID50 of the virus culture collected at different passages was determined by the Reed and Muench method. the plates were incubated for 3 days at 37°C in 5% CO2 and were scored for a cytopathic effect. brain tissues were analyzed 5 days after the inoculation with PHEV. the weight of the mice was measured every day. the weight of the mice was measured every day. all results were considered statistically significant at the p-values 0.05 level. cells, Virus, and Mice Mouse neuroblastoma N2a cells (N2a) and a human cervical carcinoma cell line (Hela) were obtained from Professor Xia (Military Veterinary Institute), Changchun, China. RNA was extracted using Trizol, tissue: 50–100 mg tissue/ml, cell: 10 cm3/ml. RNA was reverse transcribed into cDNA by using the reverse transcription kit. miR-21a-5p and Caskin1 expressions were determined by RT-PCR. generation at 95°C for 3 min, denaturation at 95°C for 30 s, annealing at 60°C for 30 s, extension at 72°C for 30 s with a total of 40 cycles. the amplification efficiency of PCR was detected. miR-21a-5p target side (Caskin1-WT-UTR) we also created a dual-luciferase miRNA Target Expression Vector by binding the 3′-UTR of mouse Caskin1 which containing an exact match to miR-21a-5p target side (Caskin1-WT-UTR the results showed that more than 80% Caskin1 mRNA and protein levels were silenced in the N2a cells. PHEV replication was significantly increased in the cells after reducing expression of Caskin1 compared to the cells transfecting with a negative-control siRNA. miR-21a-5p antagomir was injected intracerebrally three times, at 3-day intervals. the miR-21a-5p expression levels were significantly down-regulated 24 h after injection compared with the control. treatment reduces symptoms in PHEV-infected mice. the treatment with the miR-21a-5p antagomir caused a significant reduction in the miR-21a-5p expression and rescued the alterations in the Caskin1 levels. the miR-21a-5p antagomir inhibits viral proliferation by up-regulating Caskin1 and has a therapeutic effect on animals. host cell miR-145 negatively regulates replication of herpes simplex virus-1 by targeting AP27i145. multiple proteases play a key role in the host cell miRNA regulation of these proteases. miR-29b in the mouse microglial cell line was up-regulated during JEV-induced microglial activation, and miR-29b plays a role of the pro-inflammatory response. miR-21a-5p expression was up-regulated 1.5-fold in the brain cortex and hippocampus. the expression of miR-21a-5p was also up-regulated in PHEV-infected mice and increased to 3.35-fold at 5 days. this suggests that miR-21a-5p may play a role in PHEV-induced neurotoxicity. these target genes were involved in the process of cell proliferation and apoptosis. in this study, we choose Caskin1 as the target gene to be detected. Caskin1 plays a key role in motor axon targeting through interaction with the Lar-dependent signaling pathway. miR-21a-5p binds to this region of Caskin1 and suppresses its expression. the knock-down of the expression of Caskin1 promotes virus proliferation. the miRNA antagomir inhibits cytokine secretion and activation of microglia. ethics Statement All of the mouse experiments in this study were approved by the Animal Welfare Ethical Committee of the College of Veterinary Medicine, Jilin University, China. XL, KZ, YL, ZL ND, and JS performed the experiments. HL and DS contributed reagents, materials, and analysis tools.
